newsitem.title: USA: AMCORE Financial to buy Wisconsin bank.
newsitem.headline: AMCORE Financial to buy Wisconsin bank.

text.p: AMCORE Financial Inc said Wednesday it had signed a definitive agreement to acquire First National Bancorp Inc, a $214 million asset bank holding company in Monroe, Wisconsin.

Under terms of the agreement, FNB shareholders will receive 7.54 shares of AMCORE stock for each of the approximately 250,000 shares of FNB outstanding, the company said. AMCORE stock closed at 21-1/8 Wednesday, down 1/8.
The transaction is expected to close in mid-1997 and will be accounted as a pooling of interest, the company said.
If AMCORE's stock exceeds $23 a share, AMCORE can terminate the agreement unless FNB accepts a lower exchange ratio that would fix the maximum value of FNB at about $42.9 million, the companies said.
If AMCORE's stock falls below $18, FNB can terminate the deal unless AMCORE accepts a higher exchange ratio fixing FNB at a minimum value of about $33.5 million.
